dt: {bc}a metal or plastic binding on an end of a shoelace
{bc}a piece of hanging or attached material
{bc}a loop, knot, or tassel on a garment
{bc}a brief quotation used for rhetorical emphasis or sententious effect
{bc}a cardboard, plastic, or metal marker used for identification or classification
{bc}an element of code in a computer document used especially to control format and layout or to establish a hyperlink

dt.t: … nuns shared their daily lives on Instagram, Snapchat and Twitter with the {wi}tag{/wi} #MediaNuns …

dt: {bc}a string of text (such as the symbol @ followed by a person's username) that is used to {d_link|tag|tag:2} a person or account in a social media post

dt.t: While it's impossible to prohibit a friend from tagging you, Facebook allows you to review all {wi}tags{/wi} before they appear on your profile.

dt: {bc}a graffito in the form of an identifying name or symbol

et: Middle English {it}tagge{/it}; akin to Middle Low German {it}tagge, tacke{/it} twig, spike
shortdef: a loose hanging piece of cloth : tatter
a metal or plastic binding on an end of a shoelace
a piece of hanging or attached material; specifically : a loop, knot, or tassel on a garment

dt: {bc}to provide or mark with or as if with a tag: such as
{bc}to supply with an identifying marker or price
{bc}to provide with a name or epithet {bc}{sx|label||}, {sx|brand||}
{bc}to put a ticket on (a motor vehicle) for a traffic violation
{bc}to deface with a graffito usually in the form of the defacer's nickname
{bc}to supply (something, such as a social media post) with a {d_link|hashtag|hashtag}

dt.t: Don't forget to submit your photos of Montreal via Facebook, Twitter and Instagram by {wi}tagging{/wi} them with #ThisMtl.

dt: {bc}to mention (another person or account) in a social media post in a way that causes the person or account to be notified of the post

dt.t: On Facebook, if someone wants to get your attention or make it clear to others that you are somehow connected to a post, they can {wi}tag{/wi} you in it. Your name will be mentioned in the post or with the photo, and everyone else who sees it will also know that you are mentioned.
Knowing how to {wi}tag{/wi} someone on Facebook means also knowing how to {wi}tag{/wi} someone on Twitter and Instagram. Simply use the @ symbol to start a tag.
My friends went back and {wi}tagged{/wi} me in all the photos I'd missed …
Instagram allows users to reshare posts they've been {wi}tagged{/wi} in to their own Story.

shortdef: to provide or mark with or as if with a tag: such as
to supply with an identifying marker or price
to provide with a name or epithet : label, brand

dt: {bc}a game in which the player who is it chases others and tries to touch one of them who then becomes it
{bc}an act or instance of tagging a runner in baseball

shortdef: a game in which the player who is it chases others and tries to touch one of them who then becomes it
an act or instance of tagging a runner in baseball

dt: {bc}to touch in or as if in a game of tag
{bc}to put out (a runner) in baseball by a touch with the ball or the gloved hand containing the ball
{bc}to choose usually for a special purpose {bc}{sx|select||}
{bc}to make a hit or run off (a pitcher) in baseball

dt.t: the batter {it}tagged{/it} him for a home run

shortdef: to touch in or as if in a game of tag
to put out (a runner) in baseball by a touch with the ball or the gloved hand containing the ball

dt: {bc}a person who marks surfaces with graffiti

shortdef: one that tags; especially : a person who marks surfaces with graffiti

dt: {bc}to follow another's lead especially in going from one place to another

shortdef: to follow another's lead especially in going from one place to another

dt: {bc}a question (such as {it}isn't it{/it} in "it's fine, isn't it?") added to a statement or command (as to gain the assent of or challenge the person addressed)
{bc}a sentence ending in a tag question

shortdef: a question (such as isn't it in "it's fine, isn't it?") added to a statement or command (as to gain the assent of or challenge the person addressed); also : a sentence ending in a tag question
